intro: Geranium lasiocaulon, commonly known as the woolly geranium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It features upright, slender stems covered in dense, white to grayish hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink to purple, typically blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and also covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive look. Geranium lasiocaulon is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
